result.execSummary:
The defendant Dana Edward Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge. Defendant ordered to pay DNA SURCHARGE and all other costs, penalties and surcharges within 90 days of today's date. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dana Edward Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dana Edward Smith in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.

The court ordered defendant to serve 28 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 28 days time served. 

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.
Defendant ordered to pay DNA SURCHARGE and all other costs, penalties and surcharges within 90 days of today's date.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.

Filed,
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
jad

Defendant Dana Edward Smith in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's motion to adjourn not objected to by the State and granted by the court.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's motion to modify bail not objected to by State and granted by the court.  Court ordered bail set at $500.00 P.R. with turn over to Justice Point.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Dana Edward Smith not in court, in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 10.
Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED TO $250 CASH.

Defendant Dana Edward Smith in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Dana Edward Smith in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dana Edward Smith in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Dana Edward Smith in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
